channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Fall 2024 Student Course Evaluations Now Open
item.description: Date: Monday, November 25, 2024 (all day) - Course evaluations for the Fall 2024 semester will open on Monday, November 25 and remain available through Wednesday, December 11. Your feedback is very important to the Institute, the five schools, and their departments, so please be sure to complete evaluation surveys for all your courses!
item.author: Students

item.title: Don’t Forget about “Coffee & Art”!
item.description: Date: Tuesday, December 10, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Come to the Mueller Center lobby for this creative and social event, which gives students a chance to enjoy a variety of coffee options while participating in different arts-and-crafts activities in a relaxed atmosphere. It’s a perfect way to unwind, connect with peers, and engage in creative hands-on projects to explore one’s artistic talents!
item.author: Students

item.title: Mueller Center to Offer Stress Relief Day on December 11
item.description: Date: Wednesday, December 11, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Join the Mueller Center for a well-deserved destress before finals! For more information, please contact Emma Atkinson or Lauren Arnoff in the Mueller Center.
item.author: Students

item.title: Therapy Dog Group Sessions Continue December 11
item.description: Date: Wednesday, December 11, 2024 5:00 PM - 6:30 PM - Register to join other students in the Mueller Center classroom to relax, de-stress, and pet some furry friends! If you have any questions or would like more information, please contact Emma Atkinson in the Mueller Center.
item.author: Students

item.title: Society of Women Engineers Schedules December Event with Naval Nuclear Lab
item.description: Date: Monday, December 9, 2024 5:00 PM - 6:00 PM - Join the Society of Women Engineers in the Ellsworth Room on the third floor of the Union for a Professional General Body Meeting with Naval Nuclear Lab! Although an RSVP is not required, it will help determine how much food/merch is brought to the event.
item.author: Students

item.title: Rensselaer at Work to Continue Graduate Certificate Review Sessions December 10
item.description: Date: Tuesday, December 10, 2024 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., for this information session highlighting the whole range of Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate certificate programs. Three courses in length and able to be completed in as little as seven months, the certificates can add up to a customized, career-aligned master’s degree. Please register if you plan to attend.
item.author: Community

item.title: Nick Donofrio ’67 to Speak as Part of Alumni Engagement Speaker Series
item.description: Date: Monday, December 9, 2024 5:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Please join the RPI Office of Alumni Engagement for this fascinating program as alum Nick Donofrio ’67 discusses his book “If Nothing Changes, Nothing Changes” and his life experiences with an audience of alumni, students, and faculty; he will also share lessons learned from almost six decades in business and innovation. A limited number of signed copies of Nick’s book will be available, followed by a holiday mixer.
item.author: Community

item.title: Blackboard Maintenance Scheduled for December 26
item.description: Campus community members should note that Blackboard will be performing required maintenance beginning at 1:00am on Thursday, December 26, 2024. The maintenance is scheduled to last approximately six to eight hours, and the LMS will not be available during this time.
item.author: Community

item.title: Charles Curtis to Play “Nadjorlak” by Éliane Radigue
item.description: Date: Friday, December 13, 2024 7:00 PM - Composed specifically for internationally acclaimed cellist Charles Curtis and premiered in 2005, French composer Éliane Radigue’s hour-long “Naldjorlak” exists at the instrument’s limits—at the threshold of resonance and its disappearance. Performed in EMPAC Studio 2, with a reception to follow, this performance is a rare opportunity to experience its intensity up-close!
item.author: Community

item.title: Astrobiology, CCB Partnered Fall Seminar Slated for December 10
item.description: Date: Tuesday, December 10, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Dr. Samuel Marre of the Institute of Condensed Matter Chemistry, National Center for Scientific Research, University of Bordeaux, France, will speak on “High-Pressure transparent Micro- and millifluidics: From thermodynamics to materials science and biogeochemistry, studying reactive fluidic media under pressure and temperature.”
item.author: Community

item.title: Open House-Farewell to Helen Grzymala, Welcome for Ann Marie Scheidegger to be Held December 16
item.description:
Date: Monday, December 16, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Attend this event to help wish Helen Grzymala a “final” farewell on her retirement, and also to welcome Ann Marie Scheidegger as she takes over the reigns from Helen as our new Assistant Vice President for Budget and Resource Planning! Refreshments will be served.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
